required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Randomized Investigation to Evaluate Incidence of Headache Reduction in Subjects With Migraine and PFO Using the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder to Medical Management.

brief_summary.textblock: The Purpose of this study is to evaluate the impact of percutaneous closure of a patent foramen ovale (PFO) (a hole in the heart), using the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder, on the incidence of migraine headaches.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate whether percutaneous PFO closure is effective in reducing the incidence of disabling migraine headaches in patients who are refactory to medical treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Efficacy Endpoint - Percentage of Subjects With a 50% Reduction From Baseline in the Monthly Number of Migraine Attacks at 12 Months.
primary_outcome.description: A 50% reduction from the monthly number of migraine attacks during the 60-day baseline phase to the monthly number of migraine attacks during month ten through the twelfth month in the treatment phase (device group versus sham group).

primary_outcome.measure: Primary Safety Endpoint - Device Related Serious Adverse Event (SAE)
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects who experience a device-related major adverse event (DRMAE) through 12-months of follow-up. This endpoint was analyzed using an as-treated cohort that consists of all enrolled subjects who received the device (randomized and Optional PFO Closure group) and who had follow-up sufficient to adequately assess the DRMAE rate.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in the number of migraine days is calculated by the difference in the mean number of migraine days between the baseline assessment period and the treatment phase (months 10-12 post-procedure) for the respective randomization groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Successful PFO Closure at 12-months
secondary_outcome.description: Successful Closure by Core Lab Adjudicated Transcranial Doppler (TCD) Grade <= 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Migraine Disability Assessment (MIDAS) Score From Baseline to 12-months
secondary_outcome.description: The MIDAS questionnaire measure the impact of headaches on daily living. A total score of 0-5 equals little to no disability, 6-10 equals mild disability, 11-20 equals moderate disability, and a score 21 or greater equals severe disability. The maximum possible score is 276.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of a 75% Reduction in Migraine Headache Attacks

secondary_outcome.description: Procedural success is calculated by the percent of device group subjects who were implanted with the study device and experienced no serious device or procedure-related adverse events.

Percent of PFO closure group subjects who were implanted with the study device, experienced no serious device or procedure-related adverse events and have a core-lab adjudicated TCD Grade at Valsalva ≤ 2 at 1-year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of All Adverse Events at 12-months
Incidence of a 95% Reduction in Migraine Headache Attacks

other_outcome.measure: Change in Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) Scale
other_outcome.description: The difference in BDI between baseline and 12-months for the respective randomization groups. The highest possible score of the BDI is 63, which represents extreme depression. The lowest possible score is 0, which represents no depression.

arm_group.description: Will not receive the closure device, and will be treated with the current standard of care medical treatment. Will undergo Intracardiac Echo (ICE) in cardiac catheterization lab and simulate PFO closure procedure (sham procedure).
Will undergo Intracardiac Echo (ICE) in cardiac catheterization lab and undergo PFO device closure procedure with the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder.

intervention.description: Will not receive the closure device, and will be treated with the current standard of care medical treatment. Will undergo Intracardiac Echo (ICE) in cardiac catheterization lab and simulate PFO closure procedure (sham procedure). Participants completing 1 year follow-up are eligible for PFO closure with the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder.
Patients in this arm will receive the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects diagnosed as having migraine headaches both with and without aura
- Have a Patent Foramen Ovale (PFO)
- A migraine history and show a refractoriness to medical treatment
- Willing to participate in follow-up visits
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects whose primary headaches are other than migraine headaches
- Who overuse migraine treatments
- With a clinical history of stroke or Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA)
- With contraindication to aspirin therapy and Clopidogrel
- Pregnant or desire to become pregnant within the next year

facility.name: Alegent Health Bergan Mercy Medical Center

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 60 day baseline diary completion prior to randomization.

group.title: Sham Procedure
group.description: Did not receive the closure device, and treated with the current standard of care medical treatment.

group.title: Patent Foramen Ovale (PFO) Device Closure
group.description: Patent foramen ovale (PFO) device Closure procedure using the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder device.

participants_list.participants: A sham procedure was not part of this period.
Participants who completed Sham Procedure randomization Arm were eligible. 87/103 consented.

group.title: Sham Procedure
group.description: Participants will not receive the closure device, and will be treated with the current standard of care medical treatment. Will undergo Intracardiac Echo (ICE) in cardiac catheterization lab and simulate PFO closure procedure (sham procedure).

group.title: PFO Device Closure
group.description: Participants will undergo Intracardiac Echo (ICE) in cardiac catheterization lab and undergo PFO device closure procedure with the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: International Classification of Headache Disorders (ICH)
measure.description: Participants can have more than one International Classification of Headache Disorder, which is why the sum of the three categories exceeds the overall number of baseline participants.

outcome.title: Primary Efficacy Endpoint - Percentage of Subjects With a 50% Reduction From Baseline in the Monthly Number of Migraine Attacks at 12 Months.
outcome.description: A 50% reduction from the monthly number of migraine attacks during the 60-day baseline phase to the monthly number of migraine attacks during month ten through the twelfth month in the treatment phase (device group versus sham group).
outcome.population: Participants included in the analysis were followed for 1-year, had Clinical Event Committee (CEC) adjudicated headache diaries, had greater than or equal to 60% diary compliance during the treatment phase (10-12 months) and were not treatment failures.

group.title: Sham Procedure
group.description: Did not receive the closure device, and treated with the current standard of care medical treatment.

group.title: PFO Device Closure
group.description: PFO device Closure procedure using the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder device.

measure.title: Primary Efficacy Endpoint - Percentage of Subjects With a 50% Reduction From Baseline in the Monthly Number of Migraine Attacks at 12 Months.
measure.description: A 50% reduction from the monthly number of migraine attacks during the 60-day baseline phase to the monthly number of migraine attacks during month ten through the twelfth month in the treatment phase (device group versus sham group).
measure.population: Participants included in the analysis were followed for 1-year, had Clinical Event Committee (CEC) adjudicated headache diaries, had greater than or equal to 60% diary compliance during the treatment phase (10-12 months) and were not treatment failures.

outcome.title: Primary Safety Endpoint - Device Related Serious Adverse Event (SAE)
outcome.description: Number of subjects who experience a device-related major adverse event (DRMAE) through 12-months of follow-up. This endpoint was analyzed using an as-treated cohort that consists of all enrolled subjects who received the device (randomized and Optional PFO Closure group) and who had follow-up sufficient to adequately assess the DRMAE rate.
outcome.population: All enrolled subjects who received the device (randomized and Optional PFO Closure group). 5 subjects were considered to have insufficient follow-up and were therefore excluded from the analysis.

group.title: PFO Device Closure
group.description: PFO device Closure procedure using the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder device.

measure.title: Primary Safety Endpoint - Device Related Serious Adverse Event (SAE)
measure.description: Number of subjects who experience a device-related major adverse event (DRMAE) through 12-months of follow-up. This endpoint was analyzed using an as-treated cohort that consists of all enrolled subjects who received the device (randomized and Optional PFO Closure group) and who had follow-up sufficient to adequately assess the DRMAE rate.
measure.population: All enrolled subjects who received the device (randomized and Optional PFO Closure group). 5 subjects were considered to have insufficient follow-up and were therefore excluded from the analysis.

outcome.title: Change in Mean Migraine Days/Month
outcome.description: Change in the number of migraine days is calculated by the difference in the mean number of migraine days between the baseline assessment period and the treatment phase (months 10-12 post-procedure) for the respective randomization groups.

group.title: Sham Procedure
group.description: Sham Procedure and treated only with current standard of care medical treatment.

group.title: PFO Device Closure
group.description: Patients in this arm received the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder device

measure.title: Change in Mean Migraine Days/Month
measure.description: Change in the number of migraine days is calculated by the difference in the mean number of migraine days between the baseline assessment period and the treatment phase (months 10-12 post-procedure) for the respective randomization groups.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With Successful PFO Closure at 12-months
outcome.description: Successful Closure by Core Lab Adjudicated Transcranial Doppler (TCD) Grade <= 2
outcome.population: 117 device subjects completed the 12 month visit. Only 104 had TCDs that were able to be adjudicated. Of the 13 device subjects with unadjudicated TCDs, 4 did not have valsalva data and 9 did not have TCD data available for various reasons.

group.title: PFO Closure
group.description: Device group subjects who had a Core Lab adjudicated TCD grade at Valsalva of less than or equal to 2 at 12-months.

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects With Successful PFO Closure at 12-months
measure.description: Successful Closure by Core Lab Adjudicated Transcranial Doppler (TCD) Grade <= 2
measure.population: 117 device subjects completed the 12 month visit. Only 104 had TCDs that were able to be adjudicated. Of the 13 device subjects with unadjudicated TCDs, 4 did not have valsalva data and 9 did not have TCD data available for various reasons.

outcome.title: Change in Migraine Disability Assessment (MIDAS) Score From Baseline to 12-months
outcome.description: The MIDAS questionnaire measure the impact of headaches on daily living. A total score of 0-5 equals little to no disability, 6-10 equals mild disability, 11-20 equals moderate disability, and a score 21 or greater equals severe disability. The maximum possible score is 276.
outcome.population: 101 participants in the sham group and 116 subjects in the PFO device closure group had both baseline and 12-month MIDAS scores available to perform the analysis.

outcome.title: Incidence of a 75% Reduction in Migraine Headache Attacks
outcome.population: Participants were included in the analysis were followed for 1-year, have CEC adjudicated headache diaries, had greater than or equal to 60% diary compliance during the treatment phase (10-12 months) and were not treatment failures.

outcome.title: Long-Term Success

outcome.population: Percent of PFO closure group subjects who were implanted with the study device, experienced no serious device or procedure-related adverse events and have a core-lab adjudicated TCD Grade at Valsalva ≤ 2 at 1-year. 117 device subjects completed the 12 month visit. Only 104 had TCDs that were able to be adjudicated.

outcome.title: Change in Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) Scale
outcome.description: The difference in BDI between baseline and 12-months for the respective randomization groups. The highest possible score of the BDI is 63, which represents extreme depression. The lowest possible score is 0, which represents no depression.
outcome.population: 101 participants in the sham group and 116 subjects in the PFO device closure group had both baseline and 12-month BDI scores available to perform the analysis.

measure.population: 101 participants in the sham group and 116 subjects in the PFO device closure group had both baseline and 12-month BDI scores available to perform the analysis.

outcome.title: Responder Rate for Subjects in Whom Majority of Attacks Were With Aura
outcome.description: The term "majority" in "majority of migraine attacks included aura" was defined by the Neurologist (>50%) at the time of randomization based on a review of the subject's study baseline headache diary and medical history.

outcome.description: Complete Cessation of Migraine Attacks, baseline diary compared to months 10-12
outcome.population: 6 PFO Device Closure Subjects and 3 Sham Procedure Subjects with Aura do not have 12-month follow-up data available.

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events were collected from the time of signing informed consent until the 12-month follow-up visit. After the 12-month follow-up visit, serious adverse events and/or device-related events were collected until completion of study requirements.

group.title: PFO Device Closure
group.description: PFO device Closure procedure using the AMPLATZER PFO Occluder device.

group.title: Sham Procedure
group.description: Did not receive the closure device, and treated with the current standard of care medical treatment.

group.title: Optional PFO Closure
group.description: Subjects randomized to the sham arm and completed their 12-month follow up visit were given the option of PFO closure with the Amplatzer PFO Occluder.

event.sub_title: Transient atrial fibrillation after device placement

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
